file_content.text: The spires are stable once more. I'll keep the grabby rebels off them.
You can relax--I replaced the spire components.
I was just about to call in evacuation orders for the city. Well done.
The rebel slaves will think twice before tampering with Imperial property again.
Hurry. The spire could go critical any moment now.
Finally--someone who can keep their head in a crisis.
I have a job for you--an Imperial emergency. Plenty of hazard pay, but you'll have to move fast.
Rebel slaves hit my team in the jungle. They stole weapons, supplies. As if that wasn't bad enough, the idiots ransacked our spires for parts.
Without those components, we've got a lightning spire building up dangerous energy levels. It'll crater half of Kaas City if it blows!
How long until the spire explodes?
How much time do we have?
I can't say for sure. We should have at least enough time to avert the disaster.
Sounds like you Imps are in a tight spot.
Ouch.
I know--it doesn't look good.
What's a "lightning spire"?
Lightning spire?
They power Kaas City--converting lightning blasts into energy. Handy tech you'd never suspect could be the end of us.
That's my cue to bolt.
Wait! The Empire needs someone with your talent.
Most of my men ran off. Some tried to reclaim the spire parts, but the rebels cut them down--I came back here for reinforcements.
We need to recover the components the rebels stole and get that lightning spire back online before it goes critical.
The rebel scum will wish they'd never touched the spires.
I'll get your components back.
Excellent. I'll hold off on raising the alarm for a while longer.
I usually try to avoid death.
I'd be long gone if I thought we didn't have a chance. At least give it a shot.
The rebels are camped along the river. Blast them down, pry the stolen components from their hands and then reinstall them at the spire.
If the river runs red with rebel blood, I'll throw in something extra.
Not a chance. [Refuse quest]
Very well. I hope emergency reserves will arrive in time.
There's no reason to panic. No reason at all.
